intro: Anneslia suborbicularis, commonly known as the narrowleaf anneslia, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant has elliptic to ovate leaves that are often hairy and have a slightly rough texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Anneslia suborbicularis is typically found in rocky soils and dry habitats, making it a resilient species adapted to arid conditions.
